In the past, the Lord's work has been carried on altogether too much in accordance with the dictation of human agencies. . . . A time of great perplexity and distress is not the time to be in a hurry to cut the knot of difficulty. In such a time are needed men of God-given ingenuity, tact, and patience. They are to work in such a way that they will "hurt not the oil 


                                    -292- 

and the wine."--Ms 140, 1902, pp. 2, 3. ("Principles for the Guidance of Men in Positions of Responsibility," November 6, 1902.)
